subject: Science
title: Our Moon: Born from a Collision
description: A short lesson to help you apply Our Moon: Born from a Collision.

hook.text: Earth's Moon is unusually large compared to its planet. Where did it come from?

buildup.text: About 4.5 billion years ago, a Mars-sized body called Theia slammed into young Earth.

discovery.text: The debris from that collision clumped together in orbit and formed the Moon.

twist.text: Moon rocks brought back by Apollo astronauts have the same composition as Earth's.

climax.text: Without this giant impact, Earth might not have the stable tilt that allows seasons.

punchline.text: Our Moon was born from the worst day Earth ever had.

quiz.question: How did the Moon likely form?
options: From debris after a giant impact
It was captured by Earth's gravity
It split off from Earth's crust
